page.title: 06FARMING AND FISHING IN BROCK
page.content: MOST OF THE FARMING HERE IS DAIRY AND SHEEP FARMING ALTHOUGH SMALL CROPS OF POTATOES,WHEAT AND BARLEY ARE GROWN.AMONG THE LOCAL AMENITIES ARE SEVERAL SMALL PLANTATIONS SUCH AS LONGFIELD WOOD AND GONDER LANE WOOD WHICH ALSO PROVIDE SOME WOOD FOR BUILDING PURPOSES,LONGFIELD BEING A MOSTLY SPRUCE WOOD WHILE GONDER LANE WOOD IS BEECH,ASH AND SYCAMORE.TWO RIVERS,THE CALDER AND THE BROCK RUN THROUGH OUR AREA.THERE ARE NO FISH IN THE CALDER DUE TO POLUTION.A LICENCE IS NEEDED TO FISH THE RIVER BROCK AS IT IS STOCKED ANNUALLY WITH RIVER TROUT BY THE BROCK ANGLERS'ASSOCIATION
